DecisionTable.name: DecisionTable
DecisionTable.description: Represents the information about a decision table.

ConditionCriteria.description: Custom logic that's used to decide how the input fields are processed.

ConditionType.description: Condition logic that's used for input fields.

DataSourceType.description: Type of data source that’s used to create a decision table. Available in API version 59.0 and later.

DecisionTableParameters.description: Input or output field in a decision table.

DecisionTableSourceCriterias.description: Filter criteria that’s associated with the decision table condition. Available in API version 59.0 and later.

DeveloperName.description: Developer name of the decision table.

DoesConsiderNullValue.description: Indicates whether a column that has a null value is considered for lookup (true) or not (false). The default value is false. Available in API version 60.0 and later.

DownloadStatus.description: Specifies the progress status of a CSV download from a CSV-based lookup table. Available in API version 64.0 and later.

executionType.description: Indicates the backing storage for the Decision Table. Valid values are: Dmo Hbase Hbpo Solr Soql

FilterResultBy.description: If a collection of inputs returns multiple matching outputs, then the FilterResultBy field specifies how the results of a decision table are filtered.

Language.description: Language in which the decision table is created.

LastSyncDate.description: Latest date on which the decision table was refreshed.

ManageableState.description: Indicates the manageable state of the specified component that is contained in a package: beta deleted deprecated deprecatedEditable installed installedEditable released unmanaged

NamespacePrefix.description: Namespace prefix that’s associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix__componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that aren’t Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

RefreshFailureReason.description: Reason for the refresh of the decision table data to fail. Available in API version 60.0 and later.

RefreshStatus.description: Refresh status of the cached data in the decision table. Available in API version 60.0 and later. Valid values are: Initiated Failed Completed In Progress

RowLevelOverrideType.description: Specifies the row-level criteria that overrides the Decision Table column criteria.

SetupName.description: Required. Name of the decision table, which appears in Setup.

SourceConditionLogic.description: Condition logic that's used to define the decision table from the source data.

SourceObject.description: Required. Object that contains the rules based on which the decision table must provide outcomes.

Status.description: Required. Status of the decision table.

Type.description: Determine whether a decision table’s data volume is high or low.

UsageType.description: Usage type of the decision table. Available in API version 59.0 and later. Bre–Default ProductCategoryQualification ProductQualification RecordAlert When Business Rules Engine is enabled for a Salesforce org, the default value is Bre. Other usage types may be available to you depending on your industry solution and permission sets.
